items.content_html: Line-Events is a lightweight and straightforward library that operates based on the Observable pattern. It is designed to provide a simple and efficient alternative for creating Observables in JavaScript and TypeScript applications.
items.title: edfcsx/line-events: Line-Events is a lightweight and straightforward library that operates based on the Observable pattern. It is designed to provide a simple and efficient alternative for creating Observables in JavaScript and TypeScript applications.

items.content_html: A lightweight and customizable starter kit for building TypeScript libraries. It comes with ESM support, flexible configuration options, extensive ESLint rules, and built-in Github Actions integration.
items.title: 2BAD/ts-lib-starter: A lightweight and customizable starter kit for building TypeScript libraries. It comes with ESM support, flexible configuration options, extensive ESLint rules, and built-in Github Actions integration.

items.content_html: üè† A feature-rich but lightweight, buildroot-based Linux operating system alternative for your CloudFree CCU3/ELV-Charly 'homematicIP CCU' IoT smarthome central. Running as a pure virtual appliance (ProxmoxVE, Home Assistant, LXC, Docker/OCI, Kubernetes/K8s, etc.) on a dedicated embedded device (RaspberryPi, etc.) or generic x86/ARM hardware.

items.content_html: "Langswitch X is a lightweight and customizable language switcher for web applications. Easily integrate multi-language support with seamless toggling between languages. Built with flexibility and performance in mind."

items.content_html: KaliPHP is a fast, lightweight PHP framework. In an age where frameworks are a dime a dozen, We believe that KaliPHP will stand out in the crowd. It will do this by combining all the things you love about the great frameworks out there, while getting rid of the bad.
items.title: owner888/kaliphp: KaliPHP is a fast, lightweight PHP framework. In an age where frameworks are a dime a dozen, We believe that KaliPHP will stand out in the crowd. It will do this by combining all the things you love about the great frameworks out there, while getting rid of the bad.
